item.text:
These are the final words of David:

“The oracle of David son of Jesse,

the oracle of the man raised up as

the ruler chosen by the God of Jacob,

Israel’s beloved singer of songs:

The Lord’s Spirit spoke through me;

his word was on my tongue.

The God of Israel spoke,

the Protector of Israel spoke to me.

The one who rules fairly among men,

the one who rules in the fear of God,

is like the light of morning when the sun comes up,

a morning in which there are no clouds.

He is like the brightness after rain

that produces grass from the earth.

My dynasty is approved by God,

for he has made a perpetual covenant with me,

arranged in all its particulars and secured.

He always delivers me,

and brings all I desire to fruition.

But evil people are like thorns—

all of them are tossed away,

for they cannot be held in the hand.

The one who touches them

must use an iron instrument

or the wooden shaft of a spear.

They are completely burned up right where they lie!”

These are the names of David’s warriors:

Josheb Basshebeth, a Tahkemonite, was head of the officers. He killed 800 men with his spear in one battle.

<st data-num="0310" class="">Next</st> in command<n id="1" /> was <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="01734" class="">Dodo</st>,<n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0266" class="">Ahohi</st>. He was one of the <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01368" class="">warriors</st> who were <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> when they <st data-num="02778" class="">defied</st> the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> who were <st data-num="0622" class="">assembled</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> for <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st>. When the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">retreated</st>,<n id="3" />

he stood his ground and fought the Philistines until his hand grew so tired that it seemed stuck to his sword. The Lord gave a great victory on that day. When the army returned to him, the only thing left to do was to plunder the corpses.

Next in command was Shammah son of Agee the Hararite. When the Philistines assembled at Lehi, where there happened to be an area of a field that was full of lentils, the army retreated before the Philistines.
But he made a stand in the middle of that area. He defended it and defeated the Philistines; the Lord gave them a great victory.
At the time of the harvest three of the thirty leaders went down to David at the cave of Adullam. A band of Philistines was camped in the valley of Rephaim.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> was in the <st data-num="04686" class="">stronghold</st> <st data-num="0227" class="">at the time</st>, <st data-num="0227" class="">while</st> a <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistine</st> <st data-num="04673" class="">garrison</st> was in <st data-num="01035" class="">Bethlehem</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0183" class="">was thirsty</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="04310" class="">How</st> I wish someone would <st data-num="08248" class="">give</st> me some <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="08248" class="">to drink</st> from the <st data-num="0877" class="">cistern</st> in <st data-num="01035" class="">Bethlehem</st> near the <st data-num="0834 08179">gate</st>!”

So the three elite warriors broke through the Philistine forces and drew some water from the cistern in Bethlehem near the gate. They carried it back to David, but he refused to drink it. He poured it out as a drink offering to the Lord
and said, “O Lord, I will not do this! It is equivalent to the blood of the men who risked their lives by going.” So he refused to drink it. Such were the exploits of the three elite warriors.
Abishai son of Zeruiah, the brother of Joab, was head of the three. He killed 300 men with his spear and gained fame among the three.
From the three he was given honor and he became their officer, even though he was not one of the three.
Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a brave warrior from Kabzeel who performed great exploits. He struck down the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in a cistern on a snowy day.

<st data-num="01931" class="">He</st> also <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> an <st data-num="0376 04758">impressive-looking</st> <st data-num="0376 04713">Egyptian</st>.<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptian</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">wielded</st> a <st data-num="02595" class="">spear</st>, while Benaiah <st data-num="03381 0413">attacked</st><n id="2" /> him with a <st data-num="07626" class="">club</st>. He <st data-num="01497" class="">grabbed</st> the <st data-num="02595" class="">spear</st> out of the <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptian’s</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> and <st data-num="02026" class="">killed</st> him with his own <st data-num="02595" class="">spear</st>.

<st data-num="0428" class="">Such</st> were the <st data-num="06213" class="">exploits</st> of <st data-num="01141" class="">Benaiah</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03077" class="">Jehoiada</st>, who gained <st data-num="08034" class="">fame</st> among the <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01368" class="">elite warriors</st>.
He received honor from the 30 warriors, though he was not one of the three elite warriors. David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
Included with the 30 were the following: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,
<st data-num="08048" class="">Shammah</st> the <st data-num="02733" class="">Harodite</st>, <st data-num="0470" class="">Elika</st> the <st data-num="02733" class="">Harodite</st>,

<st data-num="02503" class="">Helez</st> the <st data-num="06407" class="">Paltite</st>, <st data-num="05896" class="">Ira</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06142" class="">Ikkesh</st> from <st data-num="08621" class="">Tekoa</st>,
<st data-num="044" class="">Abiezer</st> the <st data-num="06069" class="">Anathothite</st>, <st data-num="04012" class="">Mebunnai</st> the <st data-num="02843" class="">Hushathite</st>,
<st data-num="06756" class="">Zalmon</st> the <st data-num="0266" class="">Ahohite</st>, <st data-num="04121" class="">Maharai</st> the <st data-num="05200" class="">Netophathite</st>,

<st data-num="02460" class="">Heled</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="01196" class="">Baanah</st> the <st data-num="05200" class="">Netophathite</st>, <st data-num="0863" class="">Ittai</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="07380" class="">Ribai</st> from <st data-num="01390" class="">Gibeah</st> in <st data-num="01121 01144">Benjamin</st>,

<st data-num="01141" class="">Benaiah</st> the <st data-num="06553" class="">Pirathonite</st>, <st data-num="01914" class="">Hiddai</st> from the <st data-num="05158" class="">wadis</st> of <st data-num="01608" class="">Gaash</st>,
<st data-num="045" class="">Abi-Albon</st> the <st data-num="06164" class="">Arbathite</st>, <st data-num="05820" class="">Azmaveth</st> the <st data-num="01273" class="">Barhumite</st>,

<st data-num="0455" class="">Eliahba</st> the <st data-num="08170" class="">Shaalbonite</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="03464" class="">Jashen</st>, <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st>

son of<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08048" class="">Shammah</st> the <st data-num="02043" class="">Hararite</st>, <st data-num="0279" class="">Ahiam</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08325" class="">Sharar</st> the <st data-num="02043" class="">Hararite</st>,

<st data-num="0467" class="">Eliphelet</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0308" class="">Ahasbai</st> the<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01121 04602">Maacathite</st>, <st data-num="0463" class="">Eliam</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0302" class="">Ahithophel</st> the <st data-num="01526" class="">Gilonite</st>,
<st data-num="02695" class="">Hezrai</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03761" class="">Carmelite</st>, <st data-num="06474" class="">Paarai</st> the <st data-num="0701" class="">Arbite</st>,

<st data-num="03008" class="">Igal</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05416" class="">Nathan</st> from <st data-num="06678" class="">Zobah</st>, <st data-num="01137" class="">Bani</st> the <st data-num="01425" class="">Gadite</st>,

<st data-num="06768" class="">Zelek</st> the <st data-num="05984" class="">Ammonite</st>, <st data-num="05171" class="">Naharai</st> the <st data-num="0886" class="">Beerothite</st> (the <st data-num="03627" class="">armor</st>-<st data-num="05375" class="">bearer</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06870" class="">Zeruiah</st>),
<st data-num="05896" class="">Ira</st> the <st data-num="03505" class="">Ithrite</st>, <st data-num="01619" class="">Gareb</st> the <st data-num="03505" class="">Ithrite</st>,
and Uriah the Hittite. Altogether there were 37.
